creditline: Lent by Dr. James E. Standefer
text: Before modern heating systems, Japanese farming families gathered around a sunken hearth within their homes where a small fire was maintained in order to keep everyone warm during the cold winter months. High ranking or wealthy individuals, however, made use of portable braziers within their private quarters. This example, with its dramatic decoration of carp rendered in high relief, was probably fabricated for the Western market.
title: (Hibachi with Carp Design)
